docs.title: Welcome to localplan
docs.text:
python tool for local area energy planning

  • Free software: MIT license
  • Documentation: https://elgenied.github.io/localplan

docs.title: Features
docs.text: • TODO

docs.title: Credits
docs.text: This package was created with Cookiecutter and the giswqs/pypackage project template.

docs.title: v0.0.1 - Date
docs.text:
Improvement:

  • TBD

New Features:

  • TBD

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
Contributions are welcome, and they are greatly appreciated! Every little bit helps, and credit will always be given.

You can contribute in many ways:

docs.title: Report Bugs
docs.text:
Report bugs at https://github.com/elgenied/localplan/issues.

If you are reporting a bug, please include:

  • Your operating system name and version.
  • Any details about your local setup that might be helpful in troubleshooting.
  • Detailed steps to reproduce the bug.

docs.title: Fix Bugs
docs.text: Look through the GitHub issues for bugs. Anything tagged with bug and help wanted is open to whoever wants to implement it.

docs.title: Implement Features
docs.text: Look through the GitHub issues for features. Anything tagged with enhancement and help wanted is open to whoever wants to implement it.

docs.title: Write Documentation
docs.text: LocalPlan could always use more documentation, whether as part of the official LocalPlan docs, in docstrings, or even on the web in blog posts, articles, and such.

docs.title: Submit Feedback
docs.text:
The best way to send feedback is to file an issue at https://github.com/elgenied/localplan/issues.

If you are proposing a feature:

  • Explain in detail how it would work.
  • Keep the scope as narrow as possible, to make it easier to implement.
  • Remember that this is a volunteer-driven project, and that contributions are welcome :)

docs.title: Get Started!
docs.text:
Ready to contribute? Here's how to set up localplan for local development.

  1. Fork the localplan repo on GitHub.

  2. Clone your fork locally:

    $ git clone git@github.com:your_name_here/localplan.git

  3. Install your local copy into a virtualenv. Assuming you have virtualenvwrapper installed, this is how you set up your fork for local development:

    $ mkvirtualenv localplan
$ cd localplan/
$ python setup.py develop

  4. Create a branch for local development:

    $ git checkout -b name-of-your-bugfix-or-feature

    Now you can make your changes locally.

  5. When you're done making changes, check that your changes pass flake8 and the tests, including testing other Python versions with tox:

    $ flake8 localplan tests
$ python setup.py test or pytest
$ tox

    To get flake8 and tox, just pip install them into your virtualenv.

  6. Commit your changes and push your branch to GitHub:

    $ git add .
$ git commit -m "Your detailed description of your changes."
$ git push origin name-of-your-bugfix-or-feature

  7. Submit a pull request through the GitHub website.

docs.title: Pull Request Guidelines
docs.text:
Before you submit a pull request, check that it meets these guidelines:

  1. The pull request should include tests.
  2. If the pull request adds functionality, the docs should be updated. Put your new functionality into a function with a docstring, and add the feature to the list in README.rst.
  3. The pull request should work for Python 3.5, 3.6, 3.7 and 3.8, and for PyPy. Check https://github.com/elgenied/localplan/pull_requests and make sure that the tests pass for all supported Python versions.

docs.title: Stable release
docs.text:
To install LocalPlan, run this command in your terminal:

pip install localplan

This is the preferred method to install LocalPlan, as it will always install the most recent stable release.

If you don't have pip installed, this Python installation guide can guide you through the process.

docs.title: From sources
docs.text:
The sources for LocalPlan can be downloaded from the Github repo.

You can clone the public repository:

git clone git://github.com/elgenied/localplan

docs.title: localplan module
docs.text: Main module.

docs.title: Map (Map)
docs.text:
Map class

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default ipyleaflet _type_

description.

required Source code in localplan/localplan.py 
class Map(ipyleaflet.Map):
"""Map class

    Args:
        ipyleaflet (_type_): _description_.
    """    
    def __init__(self, center, zoom, **kwargs):

        if "scroll_wheel_zoom" not in kwargs:
            kwargs["scroll_wheel_zoom"] = True
        super().__init__(center=center, zoom=zoom, **kwargs)

    def add_Search_control(self, position='topleft', **kwargs):
"""add search control to map

        Args:
            position (str, optional): _description_. Defaults to 'topleft'.
        """        
        if "url" not in kwargs:
            kwargs["url"] = 'https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search?format=json&q={s}'
        search_control = ipyleaflet.SearchControl(position=position, **kwargs)
        self.add_control(search_control)

    def add_draw_control(self, **kwargs):
"""add draw control to map
        """        
        draw_control = ipyleaflet.DrawControl(**kwargs)
        draw_control.polyline =  {
            "shapeOptions": {
                "color": "#6bc2e5",
                "weight": 8,
                "opacity": 1.0
            }
        }
        draw_control.polygon = {
            "shapeOptions": {
                "fillColor": "#6be5c3",
                "color": "#6be5c3",
                "fillOpacity": 1.0
            },
            "drawError": {
                "color": "#dd253b",
                "message": "Oups!"
            },
            "allowIntersection": False
        }
        draw_control.circle = {
            "shapeOptions": {
                "fillColor": "#efed69",
                "color": "#efed69",
                "fillOpacity": 1.0
            }
        }
        draw_control.rectangle = {
            "shapeOptions": {
                "fillColor": "#fca45d",
                "color": "#fca45d",
                "fillOpacity": 1.0
            }
        }




        self.add_control(draw_control)

docs.title: add_Search_control(self, position='topleft', **kwargs)

add search control to map

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default position str

description. Defaults to 'topleft'.

'topleft' Source code in localplan/localplan.py 
def add_Search_control(self, position='topleft', **kwargs):
"""add search control to map

    Args:
        position (str, optional): _description_. Defaults to 'topleft'.
    """        
    if "url" not in kwargs:
        kwargs["url"] = 'https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search?format=json&q={s}'
    search_control = ipyleaflet.SearchControl(position=position, **kwargs)
    self.add_control(search_control)

    draw_control.polyline =  {
        "shapeOptions": {
            "color": "#6bc2e5",
            "weight": 8,

    draw_control.polygon = {

            "fillColor": "#6be5c3",
            "color": "#6be5c3",
            "fillOpacity": 1.0
        },
        "drawError": {
            "color": "#dd253b",
            "message": "Oups!"
        },
        "allowIntersection": False
    }
    draw_control.circle = {

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
To use LocalPlan in a project:

import localplan

docs.title: Folium
docs.text:
In [5]: Copied! 
import folium
import folium In [10]: Copied! 
m = folium.Map(location=[51.23622, -0.570409], zoom_start=12)
m
m = folium.Map(location=[51.23622, -0.570409], zoom_start=12) m Out[10]: Make this Notebook Trusted to load map: File -> Trust Notebook

    basemap=basemap_to_tiles(basemaps.NASAGIBS.ModisTerraTrueColorCR, "2017-04-08"),
    center=(52.204793, 360.121558),
    zoom=4
)

m

m
import leafmap m = leafmap.Map(lite_mode=True) m.add_basemap("openstreetmap") m
